context: Therefore, our data were accurate in analyzing the levels of these chemicals in human DNA. The level of 5-mdC present in the DNA sample was expressed as a percentage of total cytosine content (methylated and non-methylated). The DNA methylation level was expressed as either [5-mdC]/[dG] with adjustment to the respective 15N-labeled internal standards, or as [5-mdC]/([5-mdC]+[dC]) without internal standard adjustments. The use of dG as an internal standard allows a more simple and accurate determination of dC methylation and avoids the use of expensive isotope-labeled internal standards.Analysis of EBC 8-isoprostane The EBC was collected by ECoScreen (made by JAEGER GmbH, Wuerzburg, Germany) in polypropylene tubes and stored at −80°C until analysis. EBC 8-isoprostane levels were measured by LC–MS/MS, as described in previous study.Statistical analysis Spearman correlation coefficients were used to study the relationships between urinary 8-OHdG, WBC 8-OHdG, and global methylation levels. The distribution of 8-OHdG and global methylation levels were not normal, so the Mann-Whitney U test and Kruskal-Wallist test were used to detect differences in biomarkers between groups. Groups included workers exposed to nanomaterial vs. non-exposed controls, SiO2 handling workers vs. controls, TiO2 handling workers vs. controls, and ITO handling workers vs. controls.

The focus is on the analysis of chemical levels in DNA and other biomarkers without linking them to a decision-making process or criteria for adjudication.
